author: StevenBucher98
body:
### Summary of the new feature / enhancement

As a user, when I mistype a cmdlet or native command, I want to be able to see suggestions descriptive name and the modules they come from in order to more clearly understand suggestions to help me succeed. 

When I mistype a particular command and am returned suggestions, it is unclear what the aliased cmds do and if they are actually related to what I am trying to do or not. For example, when I type `gitt` I get the following suggestions:

```powershell
PS C:\Users\stevenbucher> gitt
gitt: The term 'gitt' is not recognized as a name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or executable program.
Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.

Suggestion [4,General]: The most similar commands are: gi, gin, gtz, It, imt.
```
It is not clear exactly what these aliased commands are and thus I have to investigate further, I have to do `Get-Command <cmd>` to learn more. This is good but it would be more helpful if this was given to me right after my initial error. 

Another example can be when I may type something like 
```powershell
PS C:\Users\stevenbucher> Get-PSResurce
Get-PSResurce: The term 'Get-PSResurce' is not recognized as a name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or executable program.
Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.

Suggestion [4,General]: The most similar commands are: Get-PSResource, Get-AzResource, Get-DscResource, Set-AzResource, Get-PSSession, Get-Service.
```
It would be helpful to know which modules each of these suggestions came from. Similar to what bash does 

```shell
stevenbucher@StevenBucherPC:~$ sudi

Command 'sudi' not found, did you mean:

  command 'sudo' from deb sudo (1.8.31-1ubuntu1.2)
  command 'sudo' from deb sudo-ldap (1.8.31-1ubuntu1.2)

Try: sudo apt install <deb name>
```

I would love to hear other's thoughts on this feature! Thanks!

### Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

Have more detailed suggestions for when suggestions are given. See examples below:

```powershell
PS C:\Users\stevenbucher> gitt
gitt: The term 'gitt' is not recognized as a name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or executable program.
Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.
Suggestion:
CommandType     Name                                               Version    Source
-----------     ----                                               -------    ------
Alias           gi -> Get-Item
Alias           gin -> Get-ComputerInfo                            7.0.0.0    Microsoft.PowerShell.Management
Alias           gtz -> Get-TimeZone                                7.0.0.0    Microsoft.PowerShell.Management
Function        It                                                 5.3.3      Pester
Alias           imt -> Invoke-PSMDTemplate                         2.2.11.139 PSModuleDevelopment
```

```powershell
PS C:\Users\stevenbucher> Get-PSresurce
Get-PSresurce: The term 'Get-PSresurce' is not recognized as a name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or executable program.
Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.

Suggestion: 
CommandType     Name                                               Version    Source
-----------     ----                                               -------    ------
Cmdlet          Get-PSResource                                     3.0.12     PowerShellGet
Cmdlet          Get-AzResource                                     6.0.1      Az.Resources
Function        Get-DscResource                                    1.1        PSDesiredStateConfiguration
Cmdlet          Set-AzResource                                     6.0.1      Az.Resources
Function        Get-PSFFeature                                     1.7.237    PSFramework
Function        Get-PSFMessage                                     1.7.237    PSFramework
```

comments.author: jhoneill
comments.body:
The first example shows that the process is not checking for external programs, which is something which should also be addressed.

This is an experimental feature which some people may prefer to leave disabled - in the case of simple typing errors we (probably) know we mean "git" or "Get-PSResource" - some people may want the current one line version and some may want the full details. So this should be an option and so should the one line version. (since the feature is still experimental, the default can be discussed) . 

At present the alias is an issue. I know that  `fl` / `ft` / `fw`  are `format-List / Table / Wide` and I know there is a `format-hex` command so I try this 
```
 type .\deleteme.txt | fh
fh: The term 'fh' is not recognized as a name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or executable program.
Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.

Suggestion [4,General]: The most similar commands are: fl, ft, fw, oh, fc, fhx, F:, h.
```

`h` _might_  be the alias, so might `oh` , `fc` doesn't look likely and I can eliminate fl/ft/fw and f: but nothing is making fhx jump out  and I might need to spend longer looking at the list thing "It OH for out-hex ? no that's `Out-host`  H for Hex ? No that's `history` " and so on   

Some aliases don't have their source (fc / fl / ft for example) and some  don't show where they go until the module is loaded (fimo for example): 
```
PS>  get-command -type Alias -Name f*

CommandType     Name                                               Version    Source
-----------     ----                                               -------    ------
Alias           fc -> Format-Custom
Alias           fhx -> Format-Hex                                  7.0.0.0    Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility
Alias           fimo ->                                            2.2.5      PowerShellGet
Alias           fimo ->                                            2.2.5      PowerShellGet
Alias           fimo ->                                            1.0.0.1    PowerShellGet
Alias           Find-SeElement                                     3.0.1      Selenium
Alias           fl -> Format-List
```

Since I mention fimo , fm doesn't find it 
```
PS>  fm
fm: The term 'fm' is not recognized as a name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or executable program.
Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.

Suggestion [4,General]: The most similar commands are: fl, ft, fw, gm, rm, fc, F:, %, ?, cp.
```

Like fh it would help the search if the logic says F  &  H  or F & M might be the first letters of the full command 
so if we find an alias for something where the canonical name is f*-h* or  f*-m*  those are good matches. It's not likely that I want % ? or cp when I typed fm. 

 So there is work to do before this feature comes out of experimental status.

title: Include module name and aliased command in suggestions from the `PSCommandNotFoundSuggestion`
